Statistical physics meets control theory. • New in Chaos, April 2022: Sandpile cascades on oscillator networks: The BTW model meets Kuramoto • Lead author, Guga Mikaberidze. • New in Phys Rev Research: Decoupled synchronized states in networks of linearly coupled limit cycle oscillators • Lead author, Anastasiya Salova, is on the postdoc job market! • New in Nature Comm: "Mutualistic networks emerging from adaptive niche-based interactions", published Oct 2020. • New in Phys Rev Letter: "Homophily can impede strutural balance", published Aug 2020. • Using the multiplex degree sequence as a probability distribution, JCN, April 2020. • "Susceptible individuals drive active social contagion", published in PRR, Nov 2019. • "Competitive percolation strategies for network recovery", published in Sci. Rep., Aug 2019. • "Koopman operator and its approximations for systems with symmetries", published in Chaos, Sep. 2019. • Our 100 page review article: Explosive Phenomena in Complex Networks (full pdf here) is published in Advances in Physics, Aug 2019. Thanks to co-authors Jan Nagler, Jesus Gomez-Gardenes, and Alex Arenas. • Raissa appointed Lead Editor, Physical Review Research, June 2019. • Raissa receives inaugural Euler Award and is elected Fellow of the Network Science Society - UC Davis Press release • New article in Science, March 8 2019: - Exotic states in a simple network of nanoelectromechanical oscillators. - UC Davis Press release - Santa Fe Institute Press release - Quanta Magazine feature April 4 2019. - Wired Magazine, April 7 2019. • Group member Marton Posfai wins the 2019 UC Davis Award for Excellence in Postdoctoral Research • Nov 2018, our paper from FSE 2008, wins the ESEC/FSE 2018 Test of Time award! • Two new papers, Aug 2018: - Self-organization of Dragon King failures, (arxiv). - Talent and experience shape competitive social hierarchies, (arxiv). • Recent Perspective piece in Nov 17, 2017 issue of Science, "Curtailing cascading failures". • UC Davis recruitment in Network Theory.
